rComments: he is too boring, stilted and full of himself

This was an okay class. At first it was interesting. Readings were long and lectures were boring most of the time. Attendance is somewhat mandatory as he gives out random quizzes and discussion questions in class without notice. Only one midterm and a final, which wasn't that hard. Easy to get a B.

Absolutely horrible at teaching! John is boring and most of his assignments(especially the Databases) are useless. This class was such a waste of time. He doesn't even do anything; it's mostly his TA's helping us. I noticed people stopped respecting him halfway in the course because they all had the "FML" look on their face.

Lectures are boring, teacher is condescending. Assignments are vague, and reading assignments are lengthy and uninteresting. Also had TAs that had learned English in the last 5 years. Also is alsmost unbearably ugly.

it will vary from quarter to quarter but i feel like the TA did all of the work the teacher was supposed to do. TA was bomb. responded to emails, knew answers, related to the students. good review sessions. grades all homework and all tests. teacher is boring, a bit edgy but the class is fair. if theres one thing you do,you should do the studyguide

I really enjoyed the class. He was very interactive with other students and entertaining.  He was pretty funny as well. The projects and assignments were very fun and enjoyable.  There was medium sized work and plenty of reading.
Good solid teacher. Good for intro class, a little too bookish for me, but fine for the course. Definitely willing to work with students.

If you have a slight interest in the tech industry or technology in general. This class will make you interested in it! I basically changed my major to ISM because of this class. Lectures COULD be boring, but mostly interesting for me. Exams are very straight forward and as long as you do the review material, should be an easy A.

Don't take this class! If you were ever interested in the subject he will make sure that you wont be. Class is boring and Mussachio does not teach it well. He knows whats going on and is great in his field, but he no clue on how to project that to his students

Easy homework, fair exams. Be warned that the grading for these exams seems quite random (may depend on the TA). You may be able to up your exam grades by a full letter grade if you argue their point. This is difficult to do though, as he isn't available often. Powerpoint is boring but honestly he does it very well - slides are clear and concise.

Going to lectures is pointless, you can get all the information from the powerpoints. READ THE ASSIGNED READING from the book. The reading from the reader - just skim it over and get the rest from pwrpoints. Take the class with two friends so you can be in one group for the business paper. Musacchio is a nice guy.

Mr. Musacchio is the worst professor I have encountered in terms of human compassion. He gave me zero support when I asked for it, due to personal issues. I tried to keep my head afloat in the class and was denied. He has been short, stern and unlikeable. Plain and simple, don't expect any exceptions for life.

teacher was so feminine and boring! all lectures were powerpoints so there was NO point in going to class. The business paper was long and somewhat pointless, as was the database project. Would not recommend this class to anyone...unless you feel like taking a good long nap!

Good teacher. This is an intro class, so he tries to keep an even playing field; but this guy knows his stuff. Homework is fairly easy. Tests are fair, and the grading spread allows for an EASY passing grade. You have to work a little bit for an A.  A word of warning. Pick your business group well. It's a big part of your grade.

He is a totally boring teacher but his homework is pretty easy accept the 15 page business paper you have to write with a group. He is very effeminate. It really doesn't matter if you go to class or not you can still get a B.

good teacher... it was his first quarter. he tried really hard and will most likely improve with each quater. I found his tests and everything to be fair. and when the homework assignments werent graded fairly by the TA, he made sure that was changed.
